prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) would begin the new year with gratitude and reflection. He emphasized starting with good deeds and seeking forgiveness.
actions: Increase dhikr and remembrance of Allah
Plan good deeds for the year ahead

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) fasted on the day of Ashura and encouraged his followers to fast on this day. He said fasting on Ashura expiates the sins of the previous year.
actions: Fast on the 9th and 10th of Muharram (or at least the 10th)
Remember the trials of the family of the Prophet

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) showed great respect and love for his grandsons, Hassan and Hussain. On this day, we remember their sacrifice and send blessings upon the Prophet's family.
actions: Send abundant Salawat upon the Prophet (PBUH)
Learn about the virtues of the Prophet's family

prophetPractices.practice: On the night of Isra and Mi'raj, the Prophet (PBUH) was taken on a miraculous journey. He received the command for the five daily prayers. This night is a time for increased worship and reflection.
actions: Reflect on the significance of the five daily prayers

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) would announce the beginning of Ramadan with joy and prepare for increased worship. He said, 'When Ramadan enters, the gates of Paradise are opened.'

The Prophet (PBUH) would seek Laylat al-Qadr in the last ten nights of Ramadan, especially on the odd nights. He said, 'Whoever stands in prayer on Laylat al-Qadr with faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven.'
actions: Spend the night in prayer and worship

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) would celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr with joy and gratitude. He would perform the Eid prayer, give charity (Zakat al-Fitr), and spend time with the community. He said, 'Every nation has its festival, and this is our festival.'
actions: Give Zakat al-Fitr before Eid prayer
Wear clean clothes and apply perfume

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) performed Hajj and taught the rites of pilgrimage. For those not performing Hajj, he encouraged remembering the pilgrims and making dua for them.
actions: Make dua for those performing Hajj
Learn about the rites of Hajj
Reflect on the significance of pilgrimage

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) said about the Day of Arafah: 'Fasting on the Day of Arafah expiates the sins of the previous year and the coming year.' For those not performing Hajj, fasting is highly recommended.
actions: Fast on this day (if not performing Hajj)

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) would celebrate Eid-ul-Adha by performing the sacrifice (Qurbani) and distributing the meat. He said, 'There is nothing dearer to Allah during the days of Eid al-Adha than the sacrificing of animals.'
actions: Distribute meat to family, friends, and the needy

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) would increase his worship in the middle of Ramadan. He said, 'Ramadan is a month whose beginning is mercy, whose middle is forgiveness, and whose end is freedom from the Fire.'
The Prophet (PBUH) would intensify his worship in the last ten days of Ramadan. Aisha (RA) reported that he would 'tighten his waist belt' (meaning he would stay up all night) and wake his family.
actions: Spend more time in the mosque (I'tikaf if possible)

prophetPractices.practice: The Prophet (PBUH) was born on this day. He would be grateful for Allah's blessings and would encourage sending abundant blessings (Salawat) upon him. He said, 'Whoever sends blessings upon me once, Allah sends blessings upon him ten times.'
actions: Send abundant Salawat upon the Prophet (PBUH)
